love_themes: Works well for light applications when properly applied
hate_themes: Weight capacity insufficient for heavier needs
perception_gaps: Consumers WANT damage-free convenience BUT NEED heavy-duty capacity
Love the philosophy, frustrated by limitations
Garage market dominated by screw-in alternatives despite damage-free appeal

garage_specific_insights.current_perception: Not considered suitable for typical garage storage (bikes, tools, ladders)
barriers: Weight capacity (max 16 lbs vs 50-100+ lb garage needs)
Long-term reliability in temperature/humidity fluctuating environments
garage_specific_insights.opportunity: IF Command could deliver 50-100 lb capacity with same damage-free promise, would fill major market gap

innovation_direction.consumer_need: Heavy-duty damage-free mounting for garage (bikes, tools, ladders 50-100+ lbs)
innovation_direction.current_solution: Screw-in steel hooks (permanent, requires drilling, leaves holes)
innovation_direction.ideal_solution: Command-style damage-free convenience + heavy-duty capacity + garage surface compatibility
innovation_direction.market_validation: Consumers explicitly wanting 'larger weight' Command options (quote #3)
